page.title: 12LANDSCAPE BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Undulating, mostly grassland, very little arable. Small fields divided mainly by hedges. Some roadside hedges being lost due to road widening,mostly on A483. Good tree cover, mostly small areas of decidous woods,one Forestry Commission conifer plantation near Garth. Some higher land still covered by bracken,though modern cultivation has reduced this. Old farm houses and buildings blend inconspicuously into landscape, but new,large, farm sheds,recently built for housing animals on some farms tend to be eyesores at present. Possibly, time and the growth of trees around them will improve their appearance. Powys County Council Highways also tend to make an eyesore out of a large lay-by on A483, which they use as a dump for all manner of road building materials.
